title: Apple could be launching a much smaller iPhone as products are predicted to shrink in 2020
text:
Apple could be set to launch a much smaller iPhone along with a pair of augmented reality glasses and an updated iPad Pro next year, according to industry rumors.

Ming-Chi Kuo, a technology analyst specializing in predicting Apple launches, has said the firm is plotting an unveiling event for the releases in March 2020.

He claims the new iPhone is likely to be called the 'iPhone SE 2' and thinks the release will be within the first few months of the year, reports 9to5Mac.

Apple has seen a recent September release of the iPhone 11 and iPhone 11 Pro (pictured) making the news of another model surprising

Mr Kuo predicts that the phone may be smaller and cheaper, with a 4 inch display similar to that of the original popular SE phone.

Updates on the phone may include a 3D sensor to measure depth for AI applications on the phone, claims Mr Kuo.

While the iPhone has seen a recent September release of the iPhone 11 and iPhone 11 Pro making the news of another release surprising, the iPad pro has not been updated for 18 months.

The iPad pro has not been updated for 18 months, Mr Kuo predicts a new release is likely

Many may question how Mr Kuo can know such insider secrets, the analyst has correctly predicted many of the most notable Apple launches.

Mr Kuo is an analyst at Tianfeng International Securities, a financial services group operating across south-east Asia.

It is believed he is able to predict what Apple have planned for release through milking contacts in the Asian Apple supply chain, reports MacRumours.

The analyst also predicts another release later in 2020 for the first Apple augmented reality headset.
description: Ming-Chi Kuo, who is known for accurately predicting Apple launches has said the firm is plotting an unveiling event for a new iPhone and iPad Pro in March 2020.
